TypeSignature.Value: .class nested public auto ansi sealed MonthCalendar/HitArea extends System.Enum

Docs.summary: Defines constants that represent areas in a control.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This enumeration includes specific areas of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar> control as its enumerated values. The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar.HitTestInfo.HitArea%2A> member of <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar.HitTestInfo> is one of these enumerated values, and indicates which portion of a month calendar is under a specified point.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar/HitArea CalendarBackground = int32(6)

Docs.summary: The specified point is part of the calendar's background.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar/HitArea Date = int32(7)

Docs.summary: The specified point is on a date within the calendar. The property of is set to the date at the specified point.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar/HitArea DayOfWeek = int32(10)

Docs.summary: The specified point is over a day abbreviation ("Fri", for example). The property of is set to January 1, 0001.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar/HitArea NextMonthButton = int32(4)

Docs.summary: The specified point is over the button at the upper-right corner of the control. If the user clicks here, the month calendar scrolls its display to the next month or set of months.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar/HitArea NextMonthDate = int32(8)

Docs.summary: The specified point is over a date from the next month (partially displayed at the top of the currently displayed month). If the user clicks here, the month calendar scrolls its display to the next month or set of months.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar/HitArea Nowhere = int32(0)

Docs.summary: The specified point is either not on the month calendar control, or it is in an inactive portion of the control.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar/HitArea PrevMonthButton = int32(5)

Docs.summary: The specified point is over the button at the upper-left corner of the control. If the user clicks here, the month calendar scrolls its display to the previous month or set of months.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar/HitArea PrevMonthDate = int32(9)

Docs.summary: The specified point is over a date from the previous month (partially displayed at the top of the currently displayed month). If the user clicks here, the month calendar scrolls its display to the previous month or set of months.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar/HitArea TitleBackground = int32(1)

Docs.summary: The specified point is over the background of a month's title.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar/HitArea TitleMonth = int32(2)

Docs.summary: The specified point is in a month's title bar, over a month name.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar/HitArea TitleYear = int32(3)

Docs.summary: The specified point is in a month's title bar, over the year value.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar/HitArea TodayLink = int32(12)

Docs.summary: The specified point is on the today link at the bottom of the month calendar control.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Forms.MonthCalendar/HitArea WeekNumbers = int32(11)

Docs.summary: The specified point is over a week number. This occurs only if the property of is enabled. The property of is set to the corresponding date in the leftmost column.
